subject: Re: [junit] Method assertEquals
msgSnippet: Hi Robert/Vladimir, You both r right. Message is thrown only when the test fails. No matter whatever testrunner implementations we use. But is there any way to
messageBody:
Hi Robert/Vladimir,

You both r right. Message is thrown only when the test fails.
No matter whatever testrunner implementations we use.

But is there any way to print my messages instead of a dot even when the test
passes.

Thanks
Sriram

Robert Sartin wrote:

> --- Thomas SMETS <tsmets@...> wrote:
> >> Assert.assertEquals("Message", expected, actual);
> >>
> >> Why is that the "Message" not getting printed on the standard
> >> output ??
> > Becoze U are bloody using the bloody junit.textui.TestRunner class
> > If you did RTFM you'd know that the message comes in the GUI
> > environment.
>
> This is, of course, incorrect.
>
> The message is printed only of the comparison fails. It appears in both
> the textui (*after* the output of the dots, "F", and "E" progress
> messsages) and the GUIs.
>
> If you did RTFM, you might miss the fact that assertEquals(String
> message, Object expected, Object actual) prints the message only if the
> assertion fails, since it is not explicitly stated in the javadoc for
> that method (as of JUnit 3.7). I can't imagine where in the
> documentation one would get the idea the message only appear in the
> GUI.
>
> To verify the statements I make above about behavior, I first read the
> javadoc, which was incomplete, then I read the source code and formed a
> hypothesis, then I ran a TestCase that had two test methods, one with:
>
> assertEquals("ONE", Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.FALSE);
>
> and one with:
>
> assertEquals("TWO", Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.TRUE);
>
> In all three TestRunner implementations (textui, awtui, and swingui)
> the message from the first (failed) assertEquals is displayed and the
> message from the second (passed) assertEquals is not. In both GUIs the
> "ONE" message appears in both the failure summary and details panes. In
> the textui, the "ONE" message appears after the dots and "F", and
> before the final summary.
>
> Regards,
>
> Rob
>
